descript.abstract: 2004-2013 Highway Safety Improvement Program Vehicle Crash Cluster Locations.The top locations where reported collisions occurred have been identified. The crash cluster analysis methodology for the crashes uses a fixed meter search distance of 25 meters (82 ft.) to merge crash clusters together. The analysis method finds nearby crashes and merges their areas together, thus creating clusters. If two distinct clusters are found to share a common crash, the two clusters are merged into a single cluster. This method of search-and-merge results in a set of many distinct clusters of different sizes and shapes Furthermore, the methodology uses the Equivalent Property Damage Only (EPDO) weighting to rank the clusters. Additionally, due to the large geographic area encompassed by the crash clusters, it was difficult to name them so they were left unnamed but can be viewed spatially.
descript.purpose: This layer shows the top 5% of crash clusters for each Regional Planning Agency between the years of 2011-2013.

idinfo.useconst: This data is in the public domain and therefore can be used by anyone for any purpose. MassDOT shall not be held liable for any errors in this data. This includes errors of omission, commission, errors concerning the content of the data, and relative and positional accuracy of the data. This data cannot be construed to be a legal document. Primary sources from which this data was compiled must be consulted for verification of information contained in this data.

enttyp.enttypd: Count of crashes within the cluster
Unique field generated in the cluster creation
Number of fatal crashes within the cluster
Number of injury crashes within the cluster
Number of property damage only crashes within the cluster
Equivalent Property Damage Only of the cluster

attr.attrdef: Fatal crashes are assigned a weight of 10. injury crashes a weight of 5 and property damage only a weight of 1

enttyp.enttypd: Second longest street within the cluster
Second longest route within the cluster
Street with the highest functional class within the cluster
Street with the second highest functional class within the cluster
Route information for street with the highest functional class within the cluster
Route information for street with the second highest functional class within the cluster
Regional planning agency/agencies where the cluster is located
Town(s) where the cluster is located
MassDOT district(s) where the cluster is located
